snippet: As New York State environmental regulators fine-tune proposed rules governing a controversial natural-gas extraction process, wastewater disposal has emerged as a challenging issue.
abstract: Wastewater disposal emerges as a challenging issue as New York State environmental regulators fine-tune proposed rules governing hydraulic fracturing, controversial natural-gas extraction process. Photos (M)4
lead_paragraph: Vexed by declining revenue, officials of the Niagara Falls water utility seized on a new moneymaking idea last year: treat toxic waste from natural-gas drilling at its sewage-treatment plant once hydrofracking gets under way in New York State. Accepting the waste would both offset the drop in revenue and help keep water rates down for customers in the economically strapped region, they reasoned.

headline.main: Wastewater Becomes Issue In Debate on Gas Drilling
